intro: Batrachium pekinense, commonly known as the Peking batrachium, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features a short, stout rhizome with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green. Its flowers are small and clustered in an inflorescence called an umbel, which is characteristic of the Araceae family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
